item.title: Can We Improve Process Per Request Performance in Node
item.description: table code { background-color: initial } table td, table th { padding: 0.5rem } How fast can an HTTP server in Node run if we spawn a process for every request? import { spawn } from "node:child_process"; import http from "node:http"; http .createServer((req, res) => spawn("echo", ["hi"]).stdout.pipe(res)) .listen(8001); You should avoid spawning a new process for every HTTP request if at all possible. Creating a new process or thread is expensive and could easily become your core bottleneck.
